intro: Alsophila macgregorii, commonly known as the MacGregor's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically a deep green and are arranged in a spiral pattern around the trunk. Alsophila macgregorii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
